(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Crippled beggars in front of 409-11 East 115th Street, north side, east of First Avenue.
July 16, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Crowd waiting in line on 115th Street, north side, between First and Pleasant Avenues, bringing their candles to the church.
The frame house in the center background is 427 East 115th Street.

July 16, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Detail of crowd waiting in line on 115th Street, north side, between First and Pleasant Avenue, bringing candles and votive offerings to the church. The woman shown here has a tall candle and a waxen image of a foot, probably to be offered in gratitude for a cure.
July 16, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A second group. The woman in the center of the picture has an image of a child.
July 16, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A girl with a candle and an image of a child, waiting very near the church door on 115th Street.
July 16, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Votive candles on sale at 409-413 East 115th Street, north side, east of First Avenue, on the eve of the Feast.

July 15, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Votive candles and images on sale on East 115th Street, on the eve of the Feast.

July 15, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Detail of another display on East 115th Street. The giant candle on the left is probably fully six feet tall. Among the votive offerings may be seen a chest, an abdomen, two pairs of hands and an arm, and a pair of feet. In the center is a statuette of Our Lady, crowned, bearing a crowned Child on her left arm.

July 15, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

text:
(1)
The watermelon season is well appreciated in New York City.
August 30, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Watermelons for sale. The lad in the foreground, is selling shopping bags.
August 2, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Another watermelon vendor, at First Ave., and 115th Street.
July 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Fruit.

text:

Worshipers with candles waiting to enter the Church of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel at 115th Street during the festivities.
July 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The statue of the patron saint being carried on First Ave. Photographer is viewing northward on same from East 113th Street.
July 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, as the preceding view.
July 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
(1)
Religious objects for sale to participants in the Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel. This stand is on the south side of East 115th Street and east of First Ave.
July 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Candles and wax figures being displayed near the Church. This stand occupies a close location to the preceding view.
July 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Jelly doughnuts for sale at the same location.
July 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
Boy peddlers carting cold soft drinks about, in the hope of selling to thirsty shoppers along 115th Street and First Ave.

July 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Soft drinks.
